title: Govt scraps GPS tracker fee for public vehicle owners
content: The Delhi government has exempted commercial passenger vehicle owners from paying the annual fee for vehicle location tracking devices. This move, benefiting approximately 1.5 lakh public vehicle owners, aims to reduce their financial burden while enhancing passenger safety. The National Informatics Centre will now handle real-time vehicle tracking and monitoring using these devices.

title: Veera Vahana and Exponent Energy unveil world's first 15-minute charging intercity electric bus - Veera Mahasamrat EV
content: Veera Vahana has collaborated with Exponent Energy to introduce the world's first 15-minute charging intercity bus, the Veera Mahasamrat EV. Equipped with a 320 kWh battery, it offers a sustainable alternative to diesel buses on long routes. The initiative begins on the Bengaluru-Hyderabad route with four 1 MW charging stations.

title: Ashok Leyland unveils GARUD 15M: India's first front engine multi-axle bus chassis
content: Ashok Leyland, the flagship of the Hinduja Group, has introduced India’s first front engine multi-axle bus chassis, GARUD 15M, at Prawaas 4.0. title: Varroc appoints Dr. Karl-Heinz Glander as Head of R&D for Business II

title: Questions about the safety of Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system are growing
content: Tesla's "Full Self-Driving" system is under scrutiny following incidents where the technology performed unsafe maneuvers. Analyst William Stein's tests found the system lacking, and a fatal crash in Seattle has raised further concerns. Federal regulators are investigating the safety of Tesla's automated driving systems.

title: Automakers’ tech alliances threaten IT’s ER&D bastion
content: Advanced Driver Assistance System (ADAS), Electric Vehicles (EVs) and Software Defined Vehicles (SDVs) are main drivers of tech spend for automakers globally, experts said to ET. An increase in the focus on high-end infotainment inside vehicles is also making software inputs for vehicles grow in recent years. As per analysts at Kotak Institutional Equities, Volkswagen and Xpeng will be jointly developing zonal E/E (electrical / electronic) architecture to turn pure electric models of Volkswagen brands into software-defined vehicles in China from 2026.

title: Auto Inc seeks policy boost for faster transition to green vehicles
content: India's adoption of electric and hybrid vehicles was significantly lower than China's, with EV penetration at 2.5% compared to China's 49%. Experts recommended incentivizing plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs) to address economic and infrastructural barriers. Major automakers supported this strategy as a vital step towards promoting cleaner mobility solutions.
